topic_metadata.title: Why do contents after `&` affect alignment?

posts.name: AprilGrimoire
posts.cooked:
Hi.

$
  #[hello]&= \
  #[world]& \
$

$
  #[hello]&= \
  #[world]&= \
$

Why is the first world slightly shifted to the right?
posts.raw:
Hi.

```typ
$
  #[hello]&= \
  #[world]& \
$

$
  #[hello]&= \
  #[world]&= \
$
```


![image|291x423, 50%](upload://uNbqqiOpaNUkqhV28YHMshAKaQW.png)

Why is the first `world` slightly shifted to the right?

posts.cooked:
Hello. Maybe the same reason it happens with this:

$
  a &) \
  a &=
$


$
  "hello" & = \
  "world" &
$

$
  "hello" & = \
  "world" & =
$

It aligns it with the equal sign.
posts.raw:
Hello. Maybe the same reason it happens with [this](https://github.com/typst/typst/issues/1268):

```typ
$
  a &) \
  a &=
$
```

![image|62x68](upload://4tnI6qqcT4UZ1IC7yNokdaKwEvU.png)


```typ
$
  "hello" & = \
  "world" &
$

$
  "hello" & = \
  "world" & =
$
```

It aligns it with the equal sign.
![image|105x162](upload://f2x4jJuI93NigJfALkmMsyQw6b7.png)

Thanks for answering!

In my initial mental model, & should be a separator, instead of attached to a character. In what layer is Typst’s alignment system? Is it builtin the rust engine or can I replace it with some custom package function?
posts.raw:

In my initial mental model, `&` should be a separator, instead of attached to a character. In what layer is Typst's alignment system? Is it builtin the rust engine or can I replace it with some custom package function?

posts.cooked:
Math alignment

If no explicit packages are used in a document, then it’s baked into the compiler written in Rust. You can change its behavior by patching the source code.
